name: Repaint Rembrandt’s Son Titus in a Monk’s Habit
description:
Rembrandts zoon Titus in monniksdracht, Rembrandt van Rijn, 1660
Repaint Rembrandt’s Son Titus in a Monk’s Habit, anattafeel, 2021

I have a strange feeling about the painting of the late Rembrandt van Rijn, I feel attracted by an unusual feeling when I look at it.

I'm trying to repaint with digital painting techniques in the way and style I want.

This is a special edition from anattafeel_ in memory of the late painter, and i will only share 1 edition.

from rijksmuseum:
Rembrandt portrays his 19-year-old son Titus as a Franciscan monk. The rules of the Order prescribe a life of poverty and humility, reflected in the sitter’s coarse cloak and air of quiet introspection. In 1660, Titus and Hendrikje, Rembrandt’s mistress, established an art business, with Rembrandt as their only employee. This enabled Rembrandt to avoid creditors and continue painting many of his best works until his death in 1669.
